text: T May hidden away in Chequers agonising over how to cling to power and to ‘deliver the will of the people’ while more than a million march against Brexit..cinematic contrast .
author: steverichards14

text: I only make a point about where the power lies in the coming years... not with the UK... but it does have the power to revoke..
author: steverichards14

text: The UK has one lever.. it can revoke Article 50 unilaterally .. all other levers are with the EU.. and that also applies in relation to the more mountainous task of agreeing trading arrangements
author: steverichards14

text: T May and Parlt-a pattern forms-no running commentary , tried to stop vote on article 50, meaningful vote imposed on her and not offered, judged in contempt of parlt and made no apology and now blaming parlt for daring to scrutinise her view that only she speaks for ‘the people’
author: steverichards14

text: Thank you...you’ve got an amazing memory!
author: steverichards14

text: In that context be careful with your amendment..T May will take it and renege later. A successor will probably  be the same.
author: steverichards14

text: So how do the four excluded cabinet ministers respond?
author: steverichards14

text: The EU should reject T May’s request for a short delay. She’s making it to keep her cabinet together for a few more hours until the next crisis and for no other reason. EU cd reframe Brexit with long delay but more likely it’s had enough and wants UK out asap..don’t blame it.
author: steverichards14

text: How the seeds were sown..episode 2 of ‘Theresa May -The Brexit Prime Minister’ is available to download here.
author: steverichards14

text: From 2016 T May assumed referendum and her view of Brexit overrode parliament.Courts forced an Art 50 vote.MPs forced a ‘meaningful vote’.She says parlt must decide what it’s for without allowing a mechanism to bring this about.Clash with a pro parliament Speaker was inevitable.
author: steverichards14

text: There were always going to be clashes between a govn and a pro parliament Speaker in a hung parliament. The clash deepens because T May convinced herself that the 2016 referendum, and her interpretation of the result,must prevail..whatever it takes.Bercow remains pro parliament.
author: steverichards14

text: Find out how we have got to where we are...tonight at 8pm on @BBCRadio4
author: steverichards14
